title: 111_hr5348
content: The "Federal Workforce Reduction Act of 2010" aims to reduce the number of federal employees. Section 3101 of title 5, United States Code is amended to include a hiring freeze for Executive agencies during fiscal year 2011 and beyond if a Federal budget deficit is projected. The President shall establish a federal workforce hiring pool for appointments. The President shall establish a Federal workforce hiring pool for Executive agencies to appoint individuals to positions approved by the President. The President shall establish a Federal workforce hiring pool for Executive agencies to appoint individuals to approved positions. The President will set regulations for the request process and approval criteria, including starting with zero positions in the pool in fiscal year 2011. After the first day of fiscal year 2011, the number of positions in the Federal workforce hiring pool will increase by .50 for each vacant full-time-equivalent position in Executive agencies and decrease by 1.0 for each approved request for a full-time equivalent position by the President. The President has the authority to waive this provision in case of emergencies or national security needs. The President may waive the hiring restrictions for national security or emergencies. The Director of the Office of Personnel Management will implement this provision. Quarterly reports to Congress are required. The President may waive hiring restrictions for national security or emergencies, with the Director of the Office of Personnel Management implementing this provision. Quarterly reports to Congress are required, containing a list of approved appointments by the President, broken down by executive agency, with position descriptions but no identifying information. Reports must be made public on the Executive Office of the President's website. The President can waive hiring restrictions for national security or emergencies, with the Director of the Office of Personnel Management implementing this provision. Quarterly reports to Congress are required, containing a list of approved appointments by the President, broken down by executive agency. Exclusion of certain executive agencies from this provision includes the Department of Defense, Homeland Security, and Veterans' Affairs.
